replace with actual network communication\n try {\n Thread.sleep(50 + (long)(Math.random() * 100)); // Simulate network delay\n return Math.random() > 0.1; // 90% success rate for simulation\n } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n return false;\n }\n }\n \n /**\n * Simulates a search operation (replace with actual implementation).\n */\n private Map<String, List<PeerInfo>> simulateSearchOperation(ServiceInstance server, String pattern) {\n // This is a placeholder - replace with actual search implementation\n Map<String, List<PeerInfo>> results = new HashMap<>();\n \n // Simulate some results\n if (pattern.contains(\"test\")) {\n List<PeerInfo> peers = new ArrayList<>();\n peers.add(new PeerInfo(\"peer1\", \"192.168.1.10\", 8001));\n results.put(\"test-file.txt\", peers);\n }\n \n return results;\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets current metrics for all index servers.\n */\n public Map<String, IndexServerMetrics> getServerMetrics() {\n return new HashMap<>(serverMetrics);\n }", "old_str_start_line_number_1": 253, "old_str_end_line_number_1": 254}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":"Now let me complete the EnhancedIndexStorageManager by adding the missing helper methods:

IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "p2p-integration-example/src/main/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/integration/EnhancedP2PSystemExample.java", "file_content": "package dev.mars.p2pjava.integration;\n\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.Peer;\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.Tracker;\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.discovery.*;\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.storage.EnhancedIndexStorageManager;\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.storage.FileBasedIndexStorage;\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.config.PeerConfig;\n\nimport java.util.*;\nimport java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;\n\n/**\n * Comprehensive example demonstrating the enhanced P2P system with:\n * - Distributed service registry with gossip protocol\n * - Enhanced conflict resolution\n * - Vector clock versioning\n * - Intelligent peer and service discovery\n * - Load-balanced index server selection\n */\npublic class EnhancedP2PSystemExample {\n \n public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {\n System.out.println(\"=== Enhanced P2P System Integration Example ===\\n\");\n \n // Configure system properties for enhanced features\n configureSystemProperties();\n \n // Start the enhanced tracker\n System.out.println(\"1. Starting Enhanced Tracker...\");\n startEnhancedTracker();\n Thread.sleep(2000); // Wait for tracker to initialize\n \n // Start enhanced peers\n System.out.println(\"\\n2. Starting Enhanced Peers...\");\n List<Peer> peers = startEnhancedPeers();\n Thread.sleep(3000); // Wait for peers to register and discover each other\n \n // Demonstrate enhanced service discovery\n System.out.println(\"\\n3. Demonstrating Enhanced Service Discovery...\");\n demonstrateServiceDiscovery(peers);\n \n // Demonstrate intelligent file indexing\n System.out.println(\"\\n4. Demonstrating Intelligent File Indexing...\");\n demonstrateFileIndexing();\n \n // Demonstrate conflict resolution\n System.out.println(\"\\n5. Demonstrating Conflict Resolution...\");\n demonstrateConflictResolution();\n \n // Show system metrics\n System.out.println(\"\\n6. System Metrics and Health...\");\n showSystemMetrics(peers);\n \n // Cleanup\n System.out.println(\"\\n7. Cleanup...\");\n cleanup(peers);\n \n System.out.println(\"\\nEnhanced P2P System Example completed successfully!\");\n }\n \n /**\n * Configures system properties for enhanced features.\n */\n private static void configureSystemProperties() {\n // Enable distributed registry for all components\n System.setProperty(\"tracker.distributed.enabled\", \"true\");\n System.setProperty(\"peer.distributed.enabled\", \"true\");\n \n // Configure gossip protocol\n System.setProperty(\"tracker.gossip.port\", \"6003\");\n System.setProperty(\"peer.gossip.port\", \"6004\");\n System.setProperty(\"tracker.gossip.interval\", \"3000\");\n System.setProperty(\"peer.gossip.interval\", \"5000\");\n \n // Configure bootstrap peers (tracker as bootstrap for peers)\n System.setProperty(\"peer.bootstrap.peers\", \"localhost:6003\");\n \n // Configure regions for testing\n System.setProperty(\"tracker.region\", \"us-east\");\n System.setProperty(\"peer.region\", \"us-east\");\n \n System.out.println(\"System properties configured for enhanced features\");\n }\n \n /**\n * Starts the enhanced tracker with distributed registry.\n */\n private static void startEnhancedTracker() {\n // The enhanced tracker will automatically use distributed registry\n // based on system properties\n new Thread(() -> {\n try {\n Tracker.main(new String[]{});\n } catch (Exception e) {\n System.err.println(\"Error starting tracker: \" + e.getMessage());\n }\n }).start();\n \n System.out.println(\"Enhanced tracker started with distributed service registry\");\n }\n \n /**\n * Starts multiple enhanced peers.\n */\n private static List<Peer> startEnhancedPeers() throws Exception {\n List<Peer> peers = new ArrayList<>();\n \n // Create 3 enhanced peers\n for (int i = 1; i <= 3; i++) {\n String peerId = \"enhanced-peer-\" + i;\n String peerHost = \"localhost\";\n int peerPort = 8000 + i;\n String trackerHost = \"localhost\";\n int trackerPort = 6000;\n \n Peer peer = new Peer(peerId, peerHost, peerPort, trackerHost, trackerPort);\n peer.start();\n peers.add(peer);\n \n System.out.println(\"Started enhanced peer: \" + peerId + \" on port \" + peerPort);\n \n // Wait a bit between peer starts to avoid port conflicts\n Thread.sleep(500);\n }\n \n // Wait for all peers to complete startup\n for (Peer peer : peers) {\n peer.waitForStartup(10000); // 10 second timeout\n }\n \n System.out.println(\"All enhanced peers started and registered\");\n return peers;\n }\n \n /**\n * Demonstrates enhanced service discovery capabilities.\n */\n private static void demonstrateServiceDiscovery(List<Peer> peers) {\n System.out.println(\"Discovering services using enhanced registry...\");\n \n for (int i = 0; i < peers.size(); i++) {\n Peer peer = peers.get(i);\n System.out.println(\"\\nPeer \" + peer.getPeerId() + \" discoveries:\");\n \n // Discover other peers\n List<ServiceInstance> discoveredPeers = peer.discoverPeers();\n System.out.println(\" Other peers discovered: \" + discoveredPeers.size());\n for (ServiceInstance discoveredPeer : discoveredPeers) {\n System.out.println(\" - \" + discoveredPeer.getServiceId() + \n \" at \" + discoveredPeer.getHost() + \":\" + discoveredPeer.getPort() +\n \" (region: \" + discoveredPeer.getMetadata().get(\"region\") + \")\");\n }\n \n // Discover trackers\n List<ServiceInstance> trackers = peer.discoverTrackers();\n System.out.println(\" Trackers discovered: \" + trackers.size());\n for (ServiceInstance tracker : trackers) {\n System.out.println(\" - \" + tracker.getServiceId() + \n \" at \" + tracker.getHost() + \":\" + tracker.getPort() +\n \" (capabilities: \" + tracker.getMetadata().get(\"capabilities\") + \")\");\n }\n }\n }\n \n /**\n * Demonstrates intelligent file indexing with enhanced storage manager.\n */\n private static void demonstrateFileIndexing() throws Exception {\n System.out.println(\"Setting up enhanced file indexing...\");\n \n // Create a distributed service registry for the storage manager\n DistributedServiceRegistry storageRegistry = new DistributedServiceRegistry(\n \"storage-manager\", 6005, Set.of(\"localhost:6003\"));\n storageRegistry.start();\n \n // Create local storage\n FileBasedIndexStorage localStorage = new FileBasedIndexStorage(\"./test-index.dat\");\n localStorage.initialize();\n \n // Create enhanced storage manager\n EnhancedIndexStorageManager storageManager = new EnhancedIndexStorageManager(\n \"storage-node-1\", storageRegistry, localStorage);\n storageManager.start();\n \n // Simulate file operations\n System.out.println(\"Performing file operations...\");\n \n // Register some files\n dev.mars.p2pjava.storage.PeerInfo peerInfo1 = new dev.mars.p2pjava.storage.PeerInfo(\"peer1\", \"192.168.1.10\", 8001);\n dev.mars.p2pjava.storage.PeerInfo peerInfo2 = new dev.mars.p2pjava.storage.PeerInfo(\"peer2\", \"192.168.1.11\", 8002);\n \n storageManager.registerFileAsync(\"document1.pdf\", peerInfo1).get();\n storageManager.registerFileAsync(\"image1.jpg\", peerInfo2).get();\n storageManager.registerFileAsync(\"video1.mp4\", peerInfo1).get();\n \n System.out.println(\"Files registered with enhanced indexing\");\n \n // Search for files\n Map<String, List<dev.mars.p2pjava.storage.PeerInfo>> searchResults = \n storageManager.searchFilesAsync(\"*.pdf\").get();\n \n System.out.println(\"Search results for '*.pdf':\");\n searchResults.forEach((fileName, peers) -> {\n System.out.println(\" \" + fileName + \" available from \" + peers.size() + \" peers\");\n });\n \n // Show index server metrics\n System.out.println(\"Index server metrics:\");\n storageManager.getServerMetrics().forEach((serverId, metrics) -> {\n System.out.println(\" \" + serverId + \": \" + metrics);\n });\n \n // Cleanup\n storageManager.stop();\n storageRegistry.stop();\n localStorage.cleanup();\n }\n \n /**\n * Demonstrates conflict resolution in action.\n */\n private static void demonstrateConflictResolution() throws Exception {\n System.out.println(\"Creating conflicting service registrations...\");\n \n // Create multiple registries that will have conflicts\n DistributedServiceRegistry registry1 = new DistributedServiceRegistry(\"conflict-peer-1\", 6006, Collections.emptySet());\n DistributedServiceRegistry registry2 = new DistributedServiceRegistry(\"conflict-peer-2\", 6007, Set.of(\"localhost:6006\"));\n \n registry1.start();\n registry2.start();\n \n Thread.sleep(1000); // Let them connect\n \n // Register conflicting services\n Map<String, String> metadata1 = Map.of(\"version\", \"1.0\", \"priority\", \"low\");\n Map<String, String> metadata2 = Map.of(\"version\", \"2.0\", \"priority\", \"high\");\n \n registry1.registerService(\"test-service\", \"conflict-service\", \"host1\", 9001, metadata1);\n registry2.registerService(\"test-service\", \"conflict-service\", \"host2\", 9002, metadata2);\n \n System.out.println(\"Conflicting services registered, waiting for resolution...\");\n Thread.sleep(3000); // Wait for gossip propagation and conflict resolution\n \n // Check resolved services\n ServiceInstance resolved1 = registry1.getService(\"test-service\", \"conflict-service\");\n ServiceInstance resolved2 = registry2.getService(\"test-service\", \"conflict-service\");\n \n System.out.println(\"Conflict resolution results:\");\n System.out.println(\" Registry 1 resolved to: \" + formatService(resolved1));\n System.out.println(\" Registry 2 resolved to: \" + formatService(resolved2));\n \n if (resolved1 != null && resolved2 != null && resolved1.getHost().equals(resolved2.getHost())) {\n System.out.println(\" \u2713 Conflict successfully resolved - both registries agree\");\n } else {\n System.out.println(\" \u26a0 Conflict resolution still in progress or failed\");\n }\n \n // Cleanup\n registry1.stop();\n registry2.stop();\n }\n \n /**\n * Shows system metrics and health information.\n */\n private static void showSystemMetrics(List<Peer> peers) {\n System.out.println(\"System Health and Metrics:\");\n \n for (Peer peer : peers) {\n System.out.println(\"\\nPeer \" + peer.getPeerId() + \":\");\n System.out.println(\" Status: Running\");\n System.out.println(\" Discovered peers: \" + peer.discoverPeers().size());\n System.out.println(\" Shared files: \" + peer.getSharedFiles().size());\n \n // Update some metadata to show dynamic updates\n peer.updatePeerMetadata(\"lastHealthCheck\", String.valueOf(System.currentTimeMillis()));\n peer.updatePeerMetadata(\"fileCount\", String.valueOf(peer.getSharedFiles().size()));\n }\n }\n \n /**\n * Cleanup resources.\n */\n private static void cleanup(List<Peer> peers) {\n for (Peer peer : peers) {\n try {\n peer.stop();\n System.out.println(\"Stopped peer: \" + peer.getPeerId());\n } catch (Exception e) {\n System.err.println(\"Error stopping peer \" + peer.getPeerId() + \": \" + e.getMessage());\n }\n }\n \n // Stop tracker (this would need to be implemented in the Tracker class)\n System.out.println(\"Tracker cleanup would be performed here\");\n }\n \n /**\n * Formats a service instance for display.\n */\n private static String formatService(ServiceInstance service) {\n if (service == null) return \"null\";\n return String.format(\"%s at %s:%d (version: %s, origin: %s)\",\n service.getServiceId(), service.getHost(), service.getPort(),\n service.getMetadata().get(\"version\"), service.getOriginPeerId());\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a comprehensive integration example that demonstrates how all these components work together:

 1	# Distributed Service Registry Implementation
 2	
 3	This document describes the distributed service registry improvements implemented for the P2P Java project, providing resilient and efficient service discovery across a peer-to-peer network.
 4	
 5	## Overview
 6	
 7	The distributed service registry extends the basic service registry with the following key features:
 8	
 9	1. **Gossip Protocol** - Efficient service information propagation
 10	2. **Conflict Resolution** - Handles inconsistencies between registry entries
 11	3. **Versioned Service Registrations** - Tracks changes and facilitates conflict resolution
 12	4. **Registry Synchronization** - Synchronizes registry state between peers
 13	5. **Anti-Entropy Mechanism** - Ensures eventual consistency
 14	
 15	## Architecture
 16	
 17	### Core Components
 18	
 19	#### 1. DistributedServiceRegistry
 20	The main distributed registry implementation that:
 21	- Extends the basic ServiceRegistry interface
 22	- Uses gossip protocol for service discovery
 23	- Maintains eventual consistency across peers
 24	- Handles conflict resolution automatically
 25	
 26	#### 2. GossipProtocol
 27	Implements epidemic-style communication for:
 28	- Efficient message propagation with configurable fanout
 29	- Message deduplication and TTL management
 30	- Peer failure detection and removal
 31	- Configurable hop limits to prevent message loops
...
 46	
 47	#### 5. AntiEntropyService
 48	Periodic reconciliation mechanism that:
 49	- Selects random peers for reconciliation
 50	- Exchanges registry snapshots
 51	- Resolves conflicts discovered during reconciliation
 52	- Provides configurable reconciliation intervals
 53	
 54	## Key Features
 55	
 56	### Gossip Protocol Implementation
 57	
 58	The gossip protocol ensures efficient and resilient service information propagation:
 59	
 60	```java
 61	// Create a distributed registry with gossip protocol
 62	DistributedServiceRegistry registry = new DistributedServiceRegistry(
 63	 "peer1", // Unique peer ID
 64	 6003, // Gossip port
 65	 Set.of("peer2:6004") // Bootstrap peers
 66	);
...

 198	peer2.registerService("db", "db-1", "host2", 5432, null);
 199	peer3.registerService("cache", "redis-1", "host3", 6379, null);
 200	
 201	// All peers can discover all services via gossip propagation
 202	List<ServiceInstance> allWebServices = peer2.discoverServices("web");
 203	List<ServiceInstance> allDbServices = peer3.discoverServices("db");
 204	```
 205	
 206	## Configuration
 207	
 208	### Gossip Protocol Configuration
 209	
 210	```java
 211	GossipProtocol gossip = new GossipProtocol(
 212	 "peer1", // Peer ID
 213	 6003, // Gossip port
 214	 5000, // Gossip interval (ms)
 215	 3, // Fanout (peers per round)
 216	 30000 // Message TTL (ms)
 217	);

 13	/**
 14	 * A distributed implementation of the ServiceRegistry interface that uses
 15	 * gossip protocol for service discovery and maintains eventual consistency
 16	 * across multiple peers in a P2P network.
 17	 */
 18	public class DistributedServiceRegistry implements ServiceRegistry {
 19	 private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(DistributedServiceRegistry.class.getName());
 20	 
 21	 private final String peerId;
 22	 private final AtomicBoolean running = new AtomicBoolean(false);
 23	 private final AtomicLong registryVersion = new AtomicLong(0);
 24	 
 25	 // Core registry storage: serviceType -> (serviceId -> ServiceInstance)
 26	 private final Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> registry = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();

 100	 registryVersion.incrementAndGet();
 101	 
 102	 // Broadcast registration to network
 103	 RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createServiceRegister(peerId, instance);
 104	 gossipProtocol.broadcast(message);
 105	 
 106	 logger.info("Registered service: " + instance);
 107	 return true;
 108	 }

 198	 @Override
 199	 public void start() {
 200	 if (running.getAndSet(true)) {
 201	 logger.warning("Registry already running");
 202	 return;
 203	 }
 204	 
 205	 logger.info("Starting distributed service registry for peer: " + peerId);
 206	 
 207	 try {
 208	 // Start gossip protocol
 209	 gossipProtocol.start();
 210	 
 211	 // Connect to bootstrap peers
 212	 connectToBootstrapPeers();
 213	 
 214	 logger.info("Distributed service registry started successfully");
 215	 
 216	 } catch (IOException e) {
 217	 running.set(false);
 218	 logger.severe("Failed to start distributed service registry: " + e.getMessage());
 219	 throw new RuntimeException("Failed to start registry", e);
 220	 }
 221	 }

 1	package dev.mars.p2pjava.discovery;
 2	
 3	import java.util.*;
 4	import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
 5	
 6	/**
 7	 * Example demonstrating how to use the distributed service registry
 8	 * with gossip protocol for P2P service discovery.
 9	 */
 10	public class DistributedRegistryExample {
 11	 
 12	 public static void main(String[] args) throws InterruptedException {
 13	 System.out.println("=== Distributed Service Registry Example ===\n");
 14	 
 15	 // Create three distributed registries representing different peers
 16	 DistributedServiceRegistry peer1 = createPeer("peer1", 6001, Collections.emptySet());
 17	 DistributedServiceRegistry peer2 = createPeer("peer2", 6002, Set.of("localhost:6001"));
 18	 DistributedServiceRegistry peer3 = createPeer("peer3", 6003, Set.of("localhost:6001", "localhost:6002"));
 19	 
 20	 try {
 21	 // Start all peers
 22	 System.out.println("Starting peers...");
 23	 peer1.start();
 24	 peer2.start();
 25	 peer3.start();
 26	 
 27	 // Wait for peers to connect
 28	 Thread.sleep(1000);
 29	 
 30	 // Register services on different peers
 31	 System.out.println("\n=== Registering Services ===");
 32	 
 33	 // Peer 1 registers a web service
 34	 peer1.registerService("web-service", "web-1", "192.168.1.10", 8080, 
 35	 Map.of("version", "1.0", "region", "us-east"));
 36	 System.out.println("Peer1: Registered web-service/web-1");
 37	 
 38	 // Peer 2 registers a database service
 39	 peer2.registerService("database", "db-primary", "192.168.1.20", 5432, 
 40	 Map.of("type", "postgresql", "role", "primary"));
 41	 System.out.println("Peer2: Registered database/db-primary");
 42	 
 43	 // Peer 3 registers another web service
 44	 peer3.registerService("web-service", "web-2", "192.168.1.30", 8080, 
 45	 Map.of("version", "1.1", "region", "us-west"));
 46	 System.out.println("Peer3: Registered web-service/web-2");
 47	 
 48	 // Wait for gossip propagation
 49	 System.out.println("\nWaiting for gossip propagation...");
 50	 Thread.sleep(2000);
 51	 
 52	 // Discover services from each peer
 53	 System.out.println("\n=== Service Discovery ===");
 54	 
 55	 System.out.println("Peer1 discovers web services:");
 56	 List<ServiceInstance> webServices1 = peer1.discoverServices("web-service");
 57	 webServices1.forEach(service -> 
 58	 System.out.println(" - " + service.getServiceId() + " at " + 
 59	 service.getHost() + ":" + service.getPort() + 
 60	 " (origin: " + service.getOriginPeerId() + ")"));

 5	/**
 6	 * Interface for service registry implementations.
 7	 * The service registry is responsible for registering and discovering services.
 8	 */
 9	public interface ServiceRegistry {
 10	 
 11	 /**
 12	 * Registers a service instance with the registry.
 13	 *
 14	 * @param serviceType The type of service (e.g., "tracker", "indexserver")
 15	 * @param serviceId A unique identifier for this service instance
 16	 * @param host The hostname or IP address of the service
 17	 * @param port The port number of the service
 18	 * @param metadata Additional metadata about the service (optional)
 19	 * @return true if registration was successful, false otherwise
 20	 */
 21	 boolean registerService(String serviceType, String serviceId, String host, int port, 
 22	 java.util.Map<String, String> metadata);
 23	 
 24	 /**
 25	 * Deregisters a service instance from the registry.
 26	 *
 27	 * @param serviceType The type of service
 28	 * @param serviceId The unique identifier of the service instance
 29	 * @return true if deregistration was successful, false otherwise
 30	 */
 31	 boolean deregisterService(String serviceType, String serviceId);
 32	 
 33	 /**
 34	 * Discovers all instances of a specific service type.
 35	 *
 36	 * @param serviceType The type of service to discover
 37	 * @return A list of ServiceInstance objects representing the discovered services
 38	 */
 39	 List<ServiceInstance> discoverServices(String serviceType);
 40	 
 41	 /**
 42	 * Gets a specific service instance by type and ID.
 43	 *
 44	 * @param serviceType The type of service
 45	 * @param serviceId The unique identifier of the service instance
 46	 * @return The ServiceInstance if found, null otherwise
 47	 */
 48	 ServiceInstance getService(String serviceType, String serviceId);
 49	 
 50	 /**
 51	 * Checks if a service instance is healthy.
 52	 *
 53	 * @param serviceType The type of service
 54	 * @param serviceId The unique identifier of the service instance
 55	 * @return true if the service is healthy, false otherwise
 56	 */
 57	 boolean isServiceHealthy(String serviceType, String serviceId);
 58	 
 59	 /**
 60	 * Updates the health status of a service instance.
 61	 *
 62	 * @param serviceType The type of service
 63	 * @param serviceId The unique identifier of the service instance
 64	 * @param healthy Whether the service is healthy
 65	 * @return true if the update was successful, false otherwise
 66	 */
 67	 boolean updateServiceHealth(String serviceType, String serviceId, boolean healthy);
 68	 
 69	 /**
 70	 * Starts the service registry.
 71	 */
 72	 void start();
 73	 
 74	 /**
 75	 * Stops the service registry.
 76	 */
 77	 void stop();
 78	}...

 164	 /**
 165	 * Broadcasts a message to the network using gossip protocol.
 166	 */
 167	 public void broadcast(RegistryMessage message) {
 168	 if (!running.get()) {
 169	 logger.warning("Cannot broadcast message: gossip protocol not running");
 170	 return;
 171	 }
 172	 
 173	 try {
 174	 outgoingMessages.offer(message, 1, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
 175	 messageCounter.incrementAndGet();
 176	 logger.fine("Queued message for broadcast: " + message.getType());
 177	 } catch (InterruptedException e) {
 178	 logger.warning("Interrupted while queuing message for broadcast");
 179	 Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
 180	 }
 181	 }

 328	 // Handle the message
 329	 MessageHandler handler = messageHandlers.get(message.getType());
 330	 if (handler != null) {
 331	 try {
 332	 handler.handleMessage(message, senderAddress);
 333	 } catch (Exception e) {
 334	 logger.warning("Error handling message " + message.getMessageId() + ": " + e.getMessage());
 335	 }
 336	 } else {
 337	 logger.fine("No handler registered for message type: " + message.getType());
 338	 }
 339	
 340	 // Propagate the message if it hasn't reached max hops
 341	 if (message.canPropagate() && !message.hasVisited(peerId)) {
 342	 RegistryMessage propagatedMessage = message.incrementHop(peerId);
 343	 outgoingMessages.offer(propagatedMessage);
 344	 }
 345	 }
 346	
 347	 /**
 348	 * Processes outgoing messages for gossip propagation.
 349	 */
 350	 private void processOutgoingMessages() {
 351	 List<RegistryMessage> messagesToSend = new ArrayList<>();
 352	 outgoingMessages.drainTo(messagesToSend, fanout * 10); // Process multiple messages at once
 353	
 354	 if (messagesToSend.isEmpty()) {
 355	 return;
 356	 }
 357	
 358	 // Get random subset of peers for gossip
 359	 List<String> targetPeers = selectGossipTargets();
 360	
 361	 if (targetPeers.isEmpty()) {
 362	 logger.fine("No peers available for gossip");
 363	 return;
 364	 }
 365	
 366	 // Send messages to selected peers
 367	 for (RegistryMessage message : messagesToSend) {
 368	 for (String peerAddress : targetPeers) {
 369	 if (!message.hasVisited(peerAddress)) {
 370	 sendMessageToPeer(message, peerAddress);
 371	 }
 372	 }
 373	 }
 374	 }

 77	 /**
 78	 * Starts the anti-entropy service.
 79	 */
 80	 public void start() {
 81	 if (running.getAndSet(true)) {
 82	 logger.warning("Anti-entropy service already running");
 83	 return;
 84	 }
 85	 
 86	 logger.info("Starting anti-entropy service for peer: " + peerId);
 87	 
 88	 // Initialize thread pools
 89	 scheduledExecutor = Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(1, r -> {
 90	 Thread t = new Thread(r, "AntiEntropy-Scheduler-" + peerId);
 91	 t.setDaemon(true);
 92	 return t;
 93	 });
 94	 
 95	 reconciliationExecutor = Executors.newCachedThreadPool(r -> {
 96	 Thread t = new Thread(r, "AntiEntropyWorker-" + peerId);
 97	 t.setDaemon(true);
 98	 return t;
 99	 });
 100	 
 101	 // Schedule periodic reconciliation
 102	 scheduledExecutor.scheduleWithFixedDelay(
 103	 this::performReconciliation,
 104	 reconciliationIntervalMs,
 105	 reconciliationIntervalMs,
 106	 TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS
 107	 );

 221	 
 222	 /**
 223	 * Performs reconciliation with a specific peer.
 224	 */
 225	 private void reconcileWithPeer(String peerAddress) {
 226	 try {
 227	 logger.fine("Starting reconciliation with peer: " + peerAddress);
 228	 
 229	 // Get current registry snapshot
 230	 Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> localSnapshot = registry.getRegistrySnapshot();
 231	 
 232	 // Create anti-entropy message with our registry state
 233	 RegistryMessage antiEntropyMessage = RegistryMessage.createAntiEntropy(peerId, localSnapshot);
 234	 
 235	 // Send anti-entropy message to peer
 236	 // Note: This would need to be implemented as a direct send method in GossipProtocol
 237	 // For now, we'll use the broadcast mechanism
 238	 gossipProtocol.broadcast(antiEntropyMessage);
 239	 
 240	 // Request peer's registry state
 241	 RegistryMessage syncRequest = RegistryMessage.createSyncRequest(peerId, Collections.emptySet());
 242	 gossipProtocol.broadcast(syncRequest);
 243	 
 244	 logger.fine("Reconciliation initiated with peer: " + peerAddress);
 245	 
 246	 } catch (Exception e) {
 247	 logger.warning("Error reconciling with peer " + peerAddress + ": " + e.getMessage());
 248	 }
 249	 }
 250	 
 251	 /**
 252	 * Manually triggers a reconciliation cycle.
 253	 */
 254	 public void triggerReconciliation() {
 255	 if (!running.get()) {
 256	 logger.warning("Cannot trigger reconciliation: service not running");
 257	 return;
 258	 }
 259	 
 260	 logger.info("Manually triggering reconciliation cycle");
 261	 reconciliationExecutor.submit(this::performReconciliation);
 262	 }

 34	 this.serviceType = serviceType;

 36	 this.host = host;
 37	 this.port = port;
 38	 this.metadata = metadata != null ? new HashMap<>(metadata) : new HashMap<>();
 39	 this.healthy = true;

 56	 public ServiceInstance(String serviceType, String serviceId, String host, int port,

 60	 this.host = host;

 7	
 8	### 1. ServiceRegistry Interface
 9	- Defines the contract for service registry implementations
 10	- Core methods include:
 11	 - `registerService()`: Registers a service instance
 12	 - `deregisterService()`: Removes a service instance
 13	 - `discoverServices()`: Finds all instances of a specific service type
 14	 - `getService()`: Gets a specific service instance
 15	 - `isServiceHealthy()`: Checks service health
 16	 - `updateServiceHealth()`: Updates health status
 17	 - `start()` and `stop()`: Lifecycle management
 18	
 19	### 2. ServiceInstance Class
 20	- Represents a service instance with:
 21	 - Service type and ID
 22	 - Host and port information
 23	 - Metadata (key-value pairs)
 24	 - Health status
 25	 - Last updated timestamp
 26	- Provides methods for updating health status and metadata

 64	 if (!running.get()) {
 65	 logger.warning("Cannot register service: registry is not running");
 66	 return false;
 67	 }
 68	 
 69	 if (serviceType == null || serviceId == null || host == null || 
 70	 serviceType.isEmpty() || serviceId.isEmpty() || host.isEmpty() || 
 71	 port < 0 || port > 65535) {
 72	 logger.warning("Cannot register service: invalid parameters");
 73	 return false;
 74	 }
 75	 
 76	 // Create versioned service instance
 77	 long version = System.currentTimeMillis();
 78	 ServiceInstance instance = new ServiceInstance(serviceType, serviceId, host, port, 
 79	 metadata, version, peerId);

 7	/**
 8	 * Advanced conflict resolution strategy for distributed service registry.
 9	 * Implements multiple resolution algorithms to handle registry inconsistencies.
 10	 */
 11	public class ConflictResolutionStrategy {
 12	 private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(ConflictResolutionStrategy.class.getName());
 13	 
 14	 public enum ResolutionPolicy {
 15	 LAST_WRITE_WINS, // Use timestamp to resolve conflicts
 16	 VECTOR_CLOCK, // Use vector clocks for causality
 17	 PEER_PRIORITY, // Use peer priority/weight
 18	 HEALTH_BASED, // Prefer healthy services
 19	 COMPOSITE // Combine multiple strategies
 20	 }
 21	 
 22	 private final ResolutionPolicy policy;
 23	 private final Map<String, Integer> peerPriorities;
 24	 private final ServiceHealthChecker healthChecker;
 25	 
 26	 public ConflictResolutionStrategy(ResolutionPolicy policy) {
 27	 this(policy, Collections.emptyMap(), null);
 28	 }
 29	 
 30	 public ConflictResolutionStrategy(ResolutionPolicy policy, 
 31	 Map<String, Integer> peerPriorities,
 32	 ServiceHealthChecker healthChecker) {
 33	 this.policy = policy;
 34	 this.peerPriorities = new HashMap<>(peerPriorities);
 35	 this.healthChecker = healthChecker;
 36	 }
 37	 
 38	 /**
 39	 * Resolves conflicts between multiple service instances.
 40	 */
 41	 public ServiceInstance resolveConflict(List<ServiceInstance> conflictingInstances) {
 42	 if (conflictingInstances == null || conflictingInstances.isEmpty()) {
 43	 return null;
 44	 }
 45	 
 46	 if (conflictingInstances.size() == 1) {
 47	 return conflictingInstances.get(0);
 48	 }
 49	 
 50	 logger.fine("Resolving conflict between " + conflictingInstances.size() + " instances using " + policy);

 157	
 158	## Usage Examples
 159	
 160	### Basic Distributed Registry Setup
 161	
 162	```java
 163	// Create distributed registry
 164	DistributedServiceRegistry registry = ServiceRegistryFactory.createDistributedRegistry(
 165	 "peer1", 6003, Set.of("bootstrap-peer:6003")
 166	);
 167	
 168	registry.start();
 169	
 170	// Register services
 171	registry.registerService("web-service", "web-1", "localhost", 8080, 
 172	 Map.of("version", "1.0", "region", "us-east"));
 173	
 174	// Discover services (includes services from other peers)
 175	List<ServiceInstance> services = registry.discoverServices("web-service");
 176	
 177	// Update service health
 178	registry.updateServiceHealth("web-service", "web-1", false);
 179	
 180	registry.stop();
 181	```
 182	
 183	### Multi-Peer Network
 184	
 185	```java
 186	// Create multiple peers
 187	DistributedServiceRegistry peer1 = new DistributedServiceRegistry("peer1", 6001, Set.of());
 188	DistributedServiceRegistry peer2 = new DistributedServiceRegistry("peer2", 6002, Set.of("localhost:6001"));
 189	DistributedServiceRegistry peer3 = new DistributedServiceRegistry("peer3", 6003, Set.of("localhost:6001"));
 190	
 191	// Start all peers
 192	peer1.start();
 193	peer2.start();
 194	peer3.start();
 195	
 196	// Register services on different peers
 197	peer1.registerService("web", "web-1", "host1", 8080, null);
 198	peer2.registerService("db", "db-1", "host2", 5432, null);
 199	peer3.registerService("cache", "redis-1", "host3", 6379, null);
 200	
 201	// All peers can discover all services via gossip propagation
 202	List<ServiceInstance> allWebServices = peer2.discoverServices("web");
 203	List<ServiceInstance> allDbServices = peer3.discoverServices("db");
 204	```

 105	
 106	 public void start() throws IOException {
 107	 if (running) {
 108	 logger.warning("Peer already running");
 109	 return;
 110	 }
 111	
 112	 running = true;
 113	 logger.info("Starting peer " + peerId + " on port " + peerPort);
 114	
 115	 // Initialize thread pools using ThreadManager for standardized thread management
 116	 connectionExecutor = ThreadManager.getCachedThreadPool(
 117	 "PeerConnectionPool-" + peerId,
 118	 "PeerConnection-" + peerId
 119	 );
 120	
 121	 // Create server socket
 122	 try {
 123	 serverSocket = new ServerSocket(peerPort);
 124	 serverSocket.setSoTimeout(SOCKET_TIMEOUT_MS);
 125	
 126	 // Start the peer startup sequence using CompletableFuture chain
 127	 startPeerAsync()
 128	 .exceptionally(ex -> {

 73

 78	
 79	 // Initialize metrics
 80	 this.metrics = ServiceMonitor.registerService("Peer-" + peerId);
 81	
 82	 logger.info("Created peer " + peerId + " at " + peerHost + ":" + this.peerPort);
 83	 }
